clinical_study.brief_title: Adherence Assessment With Travalert Dosing Aid
clinical_study.official_title: Adherence of Patients Using Travalert® for Instillation of a Fixed Combination of Travoprost 0.004%/Timolol 0.5% Compared to a Concomitant Regimen of Travoprost 0.004% and Timolol 0.5%

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to compare adherence in patients on a fixed combination of travoprost 0.004%/timolol 0.5% and patients on a concomitant combination of travoprost 0.004% and timolol 0.5% using the Travalert® device.

primary_outcome.description: Patients were considered adherent if a minimum of 80% of their instillations were administered ±2 hours of the scheduled time.

arm_group.description: One drop in the study eye once daily at 9 p.m. for six months using the Travalert device.
One drop travoprost in the study eye at 9 p.m. and one drop of timolol in the study eye twice daily (9 a.m. and 9 p.m.) for six months using a separate Travalert device for each medication.

intervention.description: One drop in the study eye once daily at 9 p.m. for six months using the Travalert device.
One drop in the study eye once daily at 9 p.m. for six months using the Travalert device.
One drop in the study eye twice daily at 9 a.m. and 9 p.m. for six months using the Travalert device.
Approved device used with study medication to record time of instillation and quantify dosing

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were recruited from 5 hospitals in Spain.
